segments.text: what did you do over the weekend ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I went a global warming rally in London . It was fantastic to be around so many people who care about the environment .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: do you think there's anything we can do to reverse the damage that's been done already ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: it might not be possible to fix the problems that we've created for ourselves , but there are lots of things we can do to prevent more damages from happening .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: well , we can use public transport instead of taking our cars for a start .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: what else can we do to protect the environment ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: if you do have to drive , you should make sure that your car runs on unleaded petrol . Also , your home should use sources of renewable energy .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: how about recycling ? Does that actually help ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: yes . You should take your glass , paper , plastic , cardboard , and tin cans to a recycling center .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: what do you think is the biggest worry for our future ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think that the issue of greatest concern is having enough sources of clean water for everyone .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I had no idea you were such as environmentalist before !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: to be honest , in order for the earth to continue to be a habitable place , we're all going to have to become more interested in the environment .
segments.speaker: S2
